Setting.Name: Ticket::Hook
Setting.Description: The identifier for a ticket, e.g. Ticket#, Call#, MyTicket#. The default is Ticket#.

Setting.Name: Ticket::HookDivider
Setting.Description: The divider between TicketHook and ticket number. E.g ': '.

Setting.Name: Ticket::SubjectSize
Setting.Description: Max size of the subjects in an email reply and in some overview screens.

Setting.Name: Ticket::SubjectRe
Setting.Description: The text at the beginning of the subject in an email reply, e.g. RE, AW, or AS.

Setting.Name: Ticket::SubjectFwd
Setting.Description: The text at the beginning of the subject when an email is forwarded, e.g. FW, Fwd, or WG.

Setting.Name: Ticket::SubjectFormat
Setting.Description: The format of the subject. 'Left' means '[TicketHook#:12345] Some Subject', 'Right' means 'Some Subject [TicketHook#:12345]', 'None' means 'Some Subject' and no ticket number. In the latter case you should verify that the setting PostMaster::CheckFollowUpModule###0200-References is activated to recognize followups based on email headers.

Setting.Name: Ticket::MergeDynamicFields
Setting.Description: A list of dynamic fields that are merged into the main ticket during a merge operation. Only dynamic fields that are empty in the main ticket will be set.

Setting.Name: Ticket::CustomQueue
Setting.Description: Name of custom queue. The custom queue is a queue selection of your preferred queues and can be selected in the preferences settings.

Setting.Name: Ticket::CustomService
Setting.Description: Name of custom service. The custom service is a service selection of your preferred services and can be selected in the preferences settings.

Setting.Name: Ticket::NewArticleIgnoreSystemSender
Setting.Description: Ignore system sender article types (e. g. auto responses or email notifications) to be flagged as 'Unread Article' in AgentTicketZoom or expanded automatically in Large view screens.

Setting.Name: Ticket::ChangeOwnerToEveryone
Setting.Description: Changes the owner of tickets to everyone (useful for ASP). Normally only agent with rw permissions in the queue of the ticket will be shown.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Responsible
Setting.Description: Enables ticket responsible feature, to keep track of a specific ticket.

Setting.Name: Ticket::ResponsibleAutoSet
Setting.Description: Automatically sets the owner of a ticket as the responsible for it (if ticket responsible feature is enabled). This will only work by manually actions of the logged in user. It does not work for automated actions e.g. GenericAgent, Postmaster and GenericInterface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::InvalidOwner::StateChange
Setting.Description: Automatically change the state of a ticket with an invalid owner once it is unlocked. Maps from a state type to a new ticket state.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Type
Setting.Description: Enables ticket type feature.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Type::Default
Setting.Description: Defines the default ticket type.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Service
Setting.Description: Allows defining services and SLAs for tickets (e. g. email, desktop, network, ...), and escalation attributes for SLAs (if ticket service/SLA feature is enabled).

Setting.Name: Ticket::Service::KeepChildren
Setting.Description: Retains all services in listings even if they are children of invalid elements.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Service::Default::UnknownCustomer
Setting.Description: Allows default services to be selected also for non existing customers.

Setting.Name: Ticket::ArchiveSystem
Setting.Description: Activates the ticket archive system to have a faster system by moving some tickets out of the daily scope. To search for these tickets, the archive flag has to be enabled in the ticket search.

Setting.Name: Ticket::ArchiveSystem::RemoveSeenFlags
Setting.Description: Controls if the ticket and article seen flags are removed when a ticket is archived.

Setting.Name: Ticket::ArchiveSystem::RemoveTicketWatchers
Setting.Description: Removes the ticket watcher information when a ticket is archived.

Setting.Name: Ticket::CustomerArchiveSystem
Setting.Description: Activates the ticket archive system search in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::NumberGenerator
Setting.Description: Selects the ticket number generator module. "AutoIncrement" increments the ticket number, the SystemID and the counter are used with SystemID.counter format (e.g. 1010138, 1010139). With "Date" the ticket numbers will be generated by the current date, the SystemID and the counter. The format looks like Year.Month.Day.SystemID.counter (e.g. 200206231010138, 200206231010139). With "DateChecksum" the counter will be appended as checksum to the string of date and SystemID. The checksum will be rotated on a daily basis. The format looks like Year.Month.Day.SystemID.Counter.CheckSum (e.g. 2002070110101520, 2002070110101535).

Setting.Name: Ticket::NumberGenerator::CheckSystemID
Setting.Description: Checks the SystemID in ticket number detection for follow-ups. If not enabled, SystemID will be changed after using the system.

Setting.Name: Ticket::NumberGenerator::MinCounterSize
Setting.Description: Sets the minimal ticket counter size if "AutoIncrement" was selected as TicketNumberGenerator. Default is 5, this means the counter starts from 10000.

Setting.Name: Ticket::NumberGenerator::Date::UseFormattedCounter
Setting.Description: Enables the minimal ticket counter size (if "Date" was selected as TicketNumberGenerator).

Setting.Name: Ticket::IndexModule
Setting.Description: IndexAccelerator: to choose your backend TicketViewAccelerator module. "RuntimeDB" generates each queue view on the fly from ticket table (no performance problems up to approx. 60.000 tickets in total and 6.000 open tickets in the system). "StaticDB" is the most powerful module, it uses an extra ticket-index table that works like a view (recommended if more than 80.000 and 6.000 open tickets are stored in the system). Use the command "bin/otrs.Console.pl Maint::Ticket::QueueIndexRebuild" for initial index creation.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Article::Backend::MIMEBase::ArticleStorage
Setting.Description: Saves the attachments of articles. "DB" stores all data in the database (not recommended for storing big attachments). "FS" stores the data on the filesystem; this is faster but the webserver should run under the OTRS user. You can switch between the modules even on a system that is already in production without any loss of data. Note: Searching for attachment names is not supported when "FS" is used.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Article::Backend::MIMEBase::CheckAllStorageBackends
Setting.Description: Specifies whether all storage backends should be checked when looking for attachments. This is only required for installations where some attachments are in the file system, and others in the database.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Article::Backend::MIMEBase::ArticleDataDir
Setting.Description: Specifies the directory to store the data in, if "FS" was selected for ArticleStorage.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Article::Backend::MIMEBase::IndexAttachmentNames
Setting.Description: Specifies whether the (MIMEBase) article attachments will be indexed and searchable.

Setting.Name: OTRSEscalationEvents::DecayTime
Setting.Description: The duration in minutes after emitting an event, in which the new escalation notify and start events are suppressed.

Setting.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###2300-ArchiveRestore
Setting.Description: Restores a ticket from the archive (only if the event is a state change to any open available state).

Setting.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###2600-AcceleratorUpdate
Setting.Description: Updates the ticket index accelerator.

Setting.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###2700-ForceOwnerResetOnMove
Setting.Description: Resets and unlocks the owner of a ticket if it was moved to another queue.

Setting.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###2800-ForceStateChangeOnLock
Setting.Description: Forces to choose a different ticket state (from current) after lock action. Define the current state as key, and the next state after lock action as content.

Setting.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###3000-ResponsibleAutoSet
Setting.Description: Automatically sets the responsible of a ticket (if it is not set yet) after the first owner update.

Setting.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###3100-LockAfterCreate
Setting.Description: When agent creates a ticket, whether or not the ticket is automatically locked to the agent.

Setting.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###3300-TicketPendingTimeReset
Setting.Description: Sets the PendingTime of a ticket to 0 if the state is changed to a non-pending state.

Setting.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###7000-NotificationEvent
Setting.Description: Sends the notifications which are configured in the admin interface under "Ticket Notifications".

Setting.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###9990-EscalationIndex
Setting.Description: Updates the ticket escalation index after a ticket attribute got updated.

Setting.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###4300-EscalationStopEvents
Setting.Description: Ticket event module that triggers the escalation stop events.

Setting.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###3600-ForceUnlockOnMove
Setting.Description: Forces to unlock tickets after being moved to another queue.

Setting.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###4000-TicketArticleNewMessageUpdate
Setting.Description: Update Ticket "Seen" flag if every article got seen or a new Article got created.

Setting.Name: CustomerCompany::EventModulePost###2300-UpdateTickets
Setting.Description: Event module that updates tickets after an update of the Customer.

Setting.Name: CustomerUser::EventModulePost###2300-UpdateTickets
Setting.Description: Event module that updates tickets after an update of the Customer User.

Setting.Name: DynamicFieldFromCustomerUser::Mapping
Setting.Description: Define a mapping between variables of the customer user data (keys) and dynamic fields of a ticket (values). The purpose is to store customer user data in ticket dynamic fields. The dynamic fields must be present in the system and should be enabled for AgentTicketFreeText, so that they can be set/updated manually by the agent. They mustn't be enabled for AgentTicketPhone, AgentTicketEmail and AgentTicketCustomer. If they were, they would have precedence over the automatically set values. To use this mapping, you have to also activate the Ticket::EventModulePost###4100-DynamicFieldFromCustomerUser setting.

Setting.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###4100-DynamicFieldFromCustomerUser
Setting.Description: This event module stores attributes from CustomerUser as DynamicFields tickets. Please see DynamicFieldFromCustomerUser::Mapping setting for how to configure the mapping.

Setting.Name: Ticket::CustomModule###001-CustomModule
Setting.Description: Overloads (redefines) existing functions in Kernel::System::Ticket. Used to easily add customizations.

Setting.Name: Ticket::SearchIndexModule
Setting.Description: Helps to extend your articles full-text search (From, To, Cc, Subject and Body search). It will strip all articles and will build an index after article creation, increasing fulltext searches about 50%. To create an initial index use "bin/otrs.Console.pl Maint::Ticket::FulltextIndex --rebuild".

Setting.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::IndexArchivedTickets
Setting.Description: Defines whether to index archived tickets for fulltext searches.

Setting.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::ForceUnfilteredStorage
Setting.Description: Force the storage of the original article text in the article search index, without executing filters or applying stop word lists. This will increase the size of the search index and thus may slow down fulltext searches.

Setting.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::WarnOnStopWordUsage
Setting.Description: Display a warning and prevent search when using stop words within fulltext search.

Setting.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::Attribute
Setting.Description: Basic fulltext index settings. Execute "bin/otrs.Console.pl Maint::Ticket::FulltextIndex --rebuild" in order to generate a new index.

Setting.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::Filters
Setting.Description: Fulltext index regex filters to remove parts of the text.

Setting.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::StopWords###en
Setting.Description: English stop words for fulltext index. These words will be removed from the search index.

Setting.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::StopWords###de
Setting.Description: German stop words for fulltext index. These words will be removed from the search index.

Setting.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::StopWords###nl
Setting.Description: Dutch stop words for fulltext index. These words will be removed from the search index.

Setting.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::StopWords###es
Setting.Description: Spanish stop words for fulltext index. These words will be removed from the search index.

Setting.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::StopWords###fr
Setting.Description: French stop words for fulltext index. These words will be removed from the search index.

Setting.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::StopWords###it
Setting.Description: Italian stop words for fulltext index. These words will be removed from the search index.

Setting.Name: Ticket::SearchIndex::StopWords###Custom
Setting.Description: Customizable stop words for fulltext index. These words will be removed from the search index.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::Overview###Small
Setting.Description: Allows having a small format ticket overview (CustomerInfo => 1 - shows also the customer information).

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::Overview###Medium
Setting.Description: Allows having a medium format ticket overview (CustomerInfo => 1 - shows also the customer information).

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::Overview###Preview
Setting.Description: Shows a preview of the ticket overview (CustomerInfo => 1 - shows also Customer-Info, CustomerInfoMaxSize max. size in characters of Customer-Info).

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::Overview::PreviewArticleSenderTypes
Setting.Description: Defines which article sender types should be shown in the preview of a ticket.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::Overview::PreviewArticleLimit
Setting.Description: Sets the count of articles visible in preview mode of ticket overviews.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::Overview::PreviewIsVisibleForCustomerExpanded
Setting.Description: Defines if the first article should be displayed as expanded, that is visible for the related customer. If nothing defined, latest article will be expanded.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::PendingDiffTime
Setting.Description: Time in seconds that gets added to the actual time if setting a pending-state (default: 86400 = 1 day).

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::MaxQueueLevel
Setting.Description: Define the max depth of queues.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ListType
Setting.Description: Shows existing parent/child queue lists in the system in the form of a tree or a list.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Watcher
Setting.Description: Enables or disables the ticket watcher feature, to keep track of tickets without being the owner nor the responsible.

Setting.Name: Ticket::WatcherGroup
Setting.Description: Enables ticket watcher feature only for the listed groups.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::BulkFeature
Setting.Description: Enables ticket bulk action feature for the agent frontend to work on more than one ticket at a time.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::BulkFeatureGroup
Setting.Description: Enables ticket bulk action feature only for the listed groups.

Setting.Name: FormDraftTTL###Ticket
Setting.Description: Defines time in minutes since last modification for drafts of specified type before they are considered expired.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::PlainView
Setting.Description: Shows a link to see a zoomed email ticket in plain text.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentZoomExpand
Setting.Description: Shows all the articles of the ticket (expanded) in the agent zoom view.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ZoomExpandSort
Setting.Description: Shows the articles sorted normally or in reverse, under ticket zoom in the agent interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ArticleHeadVisibleDefault
Setting.Description: Shows the article head information in the agent zoom view.

Setting.Name: Ticket::ZoomAttachmentDisplayCount
Setting.Description: Shows a count of attachments in the ticket zoom, if the article has attachments.

Setting.Name: Ticket::ZoomTimeDisplay
Setting.Description: Displays the accounted time for an article in the ticket zoom view.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::TicketArticleFilter
Setting.Description: Activates the article filter in the zoom view to specify which articles should be shown.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ZoomCustomerTickets
Setting.Description: Displays the number of all tickets with the same CustomerID as current ticket in the ticket zoom view.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::HistoryOrder
Setting.Description: Shows the ticket history (reverse ordered) in the agent interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::HistoryTypes###000-Framework
Setting.Description: Controls how to display the ticket history entries as readable values.

Hash.Item: Loop protection: no auto-response sent to "%s".
Created ticket [%s] in "%s" with priority "%s" and state "%s".
Added %s time unit(s), for a total of %s time unit(s).

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::TextAreaEmail
Setting.Description: Permitted width for compose email windows.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::TextAreaNote
Setting.Description: Permitted width for compose note windows.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::InformAgentMaxSize
Setting.Description: Max size (in rows) of the informed agents box in the agent interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::InvolvedAgentMaxSize
Setting.Description: Max size (in rows) of the involved agents box in the agent interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::BlockLoadingRemoteContent
Setting.Description: Makes the application block external content loading.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerInfoCompose
Setting.Description: Shows the customer user information (phone and email) in the compose screen.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerInfoComposeMaxSize
Setting.Description: Max size (in characters) of the customer information table (phone and email) in the compose screen.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerInfoZoomMaxSize
Setting.Description: Maximum size (in characters) of the customer information table in the ticket zoom view.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::DynamicFieldsZoomMaxSizeSidebar
Setting.Description: Maximum length (in characters) of the dynamic field in the sidebar of the ticket zoom view.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::DynamicFieldsZoomMaxSizeArticle
Setting.Description: Maximum length (in characters) of the dynamic field in the article of the ticket zoom view.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketOverviewSortable
Setting.Description: Controls if customers have the ability to sort their tickets.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerDisableCompanyTicketAccess
Setting.Description: This option will deny the access to customer company tickets, which are not created by the customer user.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketOverviewCustomEmptyText
Setting.Description: Custom text for the page shown to customers that have no tickets yet (if you need those text translated add them to a custom translation module).

Hash.Item: Please click the button below to create your first ticket.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketOverview###ColumnHeader
Setting.Description: Shows either the last customer article's subject or the ticket title in the small format overview.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketOverview###Owner
Setting.Description: Show the current owner in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketOverview###Queue
Setting.Description: Show the current queue in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketOverview###DynamicField
Setting.Description: Dynamic fields shown in the ticket overview screen of the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketQueue###StripEmptyLines
Setting.Description: Strips empty lines on the ticket preview in the queue view.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketQueue###ViewAllPossibleTickets
Setting.Description: Shows all both ro and rw queues in the queue view.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketQueue###HideEmptyQueues
Setting.Description: Show queues even when only locked tickets are in.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketQueue###VisualAlarms
Setting.Description: Enable highlighting queues based on ticket age.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketQueue###HighlightAge1
Setting.Description: Sets the age in minutes (first level) for highlighting queues that contain untouched tickets.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketQueue###HighlightAge2
Setting.Description: Sets the age in minutes (second level) for highlighting queues that contain untouched tickets.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketQueue###Blink
Setting.Description: Activates a blinking mechanism of the queue that contains the oldest ticket.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketQueue###UseSubQueues
Setting.Description: Include tickets of subqueues per default when selecting a queue.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketQueue###QueueSort
Setting.Description: Sorts the tickets (ascendingly or descendingly) when a single queue is selected in the queue view and after the tickets are sorted by priority. Values: 0 = ascending (oldest on top, default), 1 = descending (youngest on top). Use the QueueID for the key and 0 or 1 for value.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketQueue###SortBy::Default
Setting.Description: Defines the default sort criteria for all queues displayed in the queue view.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketQueue###PreSort::ByPriority
Setting.Description: Defines if a pre-sorting by priority should be done in the queue view.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketQueue###Order::Default
Setting.Description: Defines the default sort order for all queues in the queue view, after priority sort.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketService###StripEmptyLines
Setting.Description: Strips empty lines on the ticket preview in the service view.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketService###ViewAllPossibleTickets
Setting.Description: Shows all both ro and rw tickets in the service view.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketService###ServiceSort
Setting.Description: Sorts the tickets (ascendingly or descendingly) when a single queue is selected in the service view and after the tickets are sorted by priority. Values: 0 = ascending (oldest on top, default), 1 = descending (youngest on top). Use the ServiceID for the key and 0 or 1 for value.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketService###SortBy::Default
Setting.Description: Defines the default sort criteria for all services displayed in the service view.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketService###PreSort::ByPriority
Setting.Description: Defines if a pre-sorting by priority should be done in the service view.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketService###Order::Default
Setting.Description: Defines the default sort order for all services in the service view, after priority sort.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AccountTime
Setting.Description: Activates time accounting.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::TimeUnits
Setting.Description: Sets the prefered time units (e.g. work units, hours, minutes).

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::NeedAccountedTime
Setting.Description: Defines if time accounting is mandatory in the agent interface. If enabled, a note must be entered for all ticket actions (no matter if the note itself is configured as active or is originally mandatory for the individual ticket action screen).

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::BulkAccountedTime
Setting.Description: Defines if time accounting must be set to all tickets in bulk action.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketStatusView###ViewableTicketsPage
Setting.Description: Number of tickets to be displayed in each page.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketStatusView###SortBy::Default
Setting.Description: Defines the default ticket attribute for ticket sorting in the status view of the agent interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketStatusView###Order::Default
Setting.Description: Defines the default ticket order (after priority sort) in the status view of the agent interface. Up: oldest on top. Down: latest on top.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketEscalationView###TicketPermission
Setting.Description: Defines the required permission to show a ticket in the escalation view of the agent interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketEscalationView###ViewableTicketsPage
Setting.Description: Shows all open tickets (even if they are locked) in the escalation view of the agent interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketEscalationView###SortBy::Default
Setting.Description: Defines the default ticket attribute for ticket sorting in the escalation view of the agent interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketEscalationView###Order::Default
Setting.Description: Defines the default ticket order (after priority sort) in the escalation view of the agent interface. Up: oldest on top. Down: latest on top.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###ExtendedSearchCondition
Setting.Description: Allows extended search conditions in ticket search of the agent interface. With this feature you can search e. g. ticket title with this kind of conditions like "(*key1*&&*key2*)" or "(*key1*||*key2*)".

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###SearchLimit
Setting.Description: Maximum number of tickets to be displayed in the result of a search in the agent interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###SearchPageShown
Setting.Description: Number of tickets to be displayed in each page of a search result in the agent interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###SearchViewableTicketLines
Setting.Description: Number of lines (per ticket) that are shown by the search utility in the agent interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###SortBy::Default
Setting.Description: Defines the default ticket attribute for ticket sorting of the ticket search result of the agent interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Order::Default
Setting.Description: Defines the default ticket order in the ticket search result of the agent interface. Up: oldest on top. Down: latest on top.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###SearchArticleCSVTree
Setting.Description: Exports the whole article tree in search result (it can affect the system performance).

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###SearchCSVData
Setting.Description: Data used to export the search result in CSV format.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###ArticleCreateTime
Setting.Description: Includes article create times in the ticket search of the agent interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###Fulltext
Setting.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###TicketNumber
Setting.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###Title
Setting.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###MIMEBase_From
Setting.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###MIMEBase_To
Setting.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###MIMEBase_Cc
Setting.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###MIMEBase_Subject
Setting.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###MIMEBase_Body
Setting.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###CustomerID
Setting.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###CustomerUserLogin
Setting.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###StateIDs
Setting.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###QueueIDs
Setting.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###ServiceIDs
Setting.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###SLAIDs
Setting.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###TicketCreateTimePoint
Setting.Description: Default data to use on attribute for ticket search screen. Example: "TicketCreateTimePointFormat=year;TicketCreateTimePointStart=Last;TicketCreateTimePoint=2;".

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###TicketCreateTimeSlot
Setting.Description: Default data to use on attribute for ticket search screen. Example: "TicketCreateTimeStartYear=2010;TicketCreateTimeStartMonth=10;TicketCreateTimeStartDay=4;TicketCreateTimeStopYear=2010;TicketCreateTimeStopMonth=11;TicketCreateTimeStopDay=3;".

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###TicketChangeTimePoint
Setting.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###TicketChangeTimeSlot
Setting.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###TicketCloseTimePoint
Setting.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###TicketCloseTimeSlot
Setting.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###TicketEscalationTimePoint
Setting.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###TicketEscalationTimeSlot
Setting.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###ArticleCreateTimePoint
Setting.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###ArticleCreateTimeSlot
Setting.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###Defaults###SearchInArchive
Setting.Description: Defines the default shown ticket search attribute for ticket search screen (AllTickets/ArchivedTickets/NotArchivedTickets).

Setting.Name: Frontend::Search###Ticket
Setting.Description: Search backend router.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketLockedView###SortBy::Default
Setting.Description: Defines the default ticket attribute for ticket sorting in the locked ticket view of the agent interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketLockedView###Order::Default
Setting.Description: Defines the default ticket order in the ticket locked view of the agent interface. Up: oldest on top. Down: latest on top.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketResponsibleView###SortBy::Default
Setting.Description: Defines the default ticket attribute for ticket sorting in the responsible view of the agent interface.

Setting.Description: Determines the strings that will be shown as recipient (To:) of the phone ticket and as sender (From:) of the email ticket in the agent interface. For Queue as NewQueueSelectionType "<Queue>" shows the names of the queues and for SystemAddress "<Realname> <<Email>>" shows the name and email of the recipient.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketCompose###RichTextHeight
Setting.Description: Defines the height for the rich text editor component for this screen. Enter number (pixels) or percent value (relative).

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ResponseFormat
Setting.Description: Defines the format of responses in the ticket compose screen of the agent interface ([% Data.OrigFrom | html %] is From 1:1, [% Data.OrigFromName | html %] is only realname of From).

Value.Item:
[% Data.Salutation | html %] [% Data.StdResponse | html %] [% Data.Signature | html %]
[% Data.CreateTime | Localize("TimeShort") %] - [% Data.OrigFromName | html %] [% Translate("wrote") | html %]: [% Data.Body | html %]

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::Quote
Setting.Description: Defines the used character for plaintext email quotes in the ticket compose screen of the agent interface. If this is empty or inactive, original emails will not be quoted but appended to the response.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ResponseQuoteMaxLines
Setting.Description: Defines the maximum number of quoted lines to be added to responses.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ComposeAddCustomerAddress
Setting.Description: Adds customers email addresses to recipients in the ticket compose screen of the agent interface. The customers email address won't be added if the article type is email-internal.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ComposeReplaceSenderAddress
Setting.Description: Replaces the original sender with current customer's email address on compose answer in the ticket compose screen of the agent interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketCustomer::CustomerIDReadOnly
Setting.Description: Controls if CustomerID is read-only in the agent interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::MergeText
Setting.Description: When tickets are merged, the customer can be informed per email by setting the check box "Inform Sender". In this text area, you can define a pre-formatted text which can later be modified by the agents.

Value.Item: Your email with ticket number "<OTRS_TICKET>" is merged to "<OTRS_MERGE_TO_TICKET>".

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AutomaticMergeSubject
Setting.Description: When tickets are merged, a note will be added automatically to the ticket which is no longer active. Here you can define the subject of this note (this subject cannot be changed by the agent).

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AutomaticMergeText
Setting.Description: When tickets are merged, a note will be added automatically to the ticket which is no longer active. Here you can define the body of this note (this text cannot be changed by the agent).

Setting.Name: Ticket::ViewableSenderTypes
Setting.Description: Defines the default viewable sender types of a ticket (default: customer).

Setting.Name: Ticket::ViewableLocks
Setting.Description: Defines the viewable locks of a ticket. NOTE: When you change this setting, make sure to delete the cache in order to use the new value. Default: unlock, tmp_lock.

Setting.Name: Ticket::ViewableStateType
Setting.Description: Defines the valid state types for a ticket. If a ticket is in a state which have any state type from this setting, this ticket will be considered as open, otherwise as closed.

Setting.Name: Ticket::UnlockStateType
Setting.Description: Defines the valid states for unlocked tickets. To unlock tickets the script "bin/otrs.Console.pl Maint::Ticket::UnlockTimeout" can be used.

Setting.Name: Ticket::PendingNotificationOnlyToOwner
Setting.Description: Sends reminder notifications of unlocked ticket after reaching the reminder date (only sent to ticket owner).

Setting.Name: Ticket::PendingNotificationNotToResponsible
Setting.Description: Disables sending reminder notifications to the responsible agent of a ticket (Ticket::Responsible needs to be enabled).

Setting.Name: Ticket::PendingReminderStateType
Setting.Description: Defines the state type of the reminder for pending tickets.

Setting.Name: Ticket::PendingAutoStateType
Setting.Description: Determines the possible states for pending tickets that changed state after reaching time limit.

Setting.Name: Ticket::StateAfterPending
Setting.Description: Defines which states should be set automatically (Content), after the pending time of state (Key) has been reached.

Setting.Name: CustomerDBLink
Setting.Description: Defines an external link to the database of the customer (e.g. 'http://yourhost/customer.php?CID=[% Data.CustomerID %]' or '').

Setting.Name: CustomerDBLinkTarget
Setting.Description: Defines the target attribute in the link to external customer database. E.g. 'target="cdb"'.

Setting.Name: CustomerDBLinkClass
Setting.Description: Defines the target attribute in the link to external customer database. E.g. 'AsPopup PopupType_TicketAction'.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Permission###1-OwnerCheck
Setting.Description: Module to grant access to the owner of a ticket.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Permission::OwnerCheck::Queues
Setting.Description: Optional queue limitation for the OwnerCheck permission module. If set, permission is only granted for tickets in the specified queues.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Permission###2-ResponsibleCheck
Setting.Description: Module to grant access to the agent responsible of a ticket.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Permission::ResponsibleCheck::Queues
Setting.Description: Optional queue limitation for the ResponsibleCheck permission module. If set, permission is only granted for tickets in the specified queues.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Permission###3-GroupCheck
Setting.Description: Module to check the group permissions for the access to tickets.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Permission###4-WatcherCheck
Setting.Description: Module to grant access to the watcher agents of a ticket.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Permission###5-CreatorCheck
Setting.Description: Module to grant access to the creator of a ticket.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Permission::CreatorCheck::Queues
Setting.Description: Optional queue limitation for the CreatorCheck permission module. If set, permission is only granted for tickets in the specified queues.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Permission###6-InvolvedCheck
Setting.Description: Module to grant access to any agent that has been involved in a ticket in the past (based on ticket history entries).

Setting.Name: Ticket::Permission::InvolvedCheck::Queues
Setting.Description: Optional queue limitation for the InvolvedCheck permission module. If set, permission is only granted for tickets in the specified queues.

Setting.Name: CustomerTicket::Permission###1-GroupCheck
Setting.Description: Module to check the group permissions for customer access to tickets.

Setting.Name: CustomerTicket::Permission###2-CustomerUserIDCheck
Setting.Description: Module to grant access if the CustomerUserID of the ticket matches the CustomerUserID of the customer.

Setting.Name: CustomerTicket::Permission###3-CustomerIDCheck
Setting.Description: Module to grant access if the CustomerID of the ticket matches the CustomerID of the customer.

Setting.Name: CustomerTicket::Permission###4-CustomerGroupCheck
Setting.Description: Module to grant access if the CustomerID of the customer has necessary group permissions.

Setting.Name: Ticket::DefineEmailFrom

Item.Item: Agent Name + FromSeparator + System Address Display Name

Setting.Name: Ticket::DefineEmailFromSeparator
Setting.Description: Defines the separator between the agents real name and the given queue email address.

Setting.Name: DashboardBackend###0100-TicketPendingReminder
Setting.Description: Parameters for the dashboard backend of the ticket pending reminder overview of the agent interface . "Limit" is the number of entries shown by default. "Group" is used to restrict the access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" determines if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTLLocal" is the cache time in minutes for the plugin. "Mandatory" determines if the plugin is always shown and can not be removed by agents. Note: Only Ticket attributes and Dynamic Fields (DynamicField_NameX) are allowed for DefaultColumns.

Hash.Item: All tickets with a reminder set where the reminder date has been reached

Setting.Description: Parameters for the dashboard backend of the ticket escalation overview of the agent interface . "Limit" is the number of entries shown by default. Setting.Name: DashboardBackend###0270-TicketQueueOverview
Setting.Description: Parameters for the dashboard backend of the queue overview widget of the agent interface. "Group" is used to restrict the access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "QueuePermissionGroup" is not mandatory, queues are only listed if they belong to this permission group if you enable it. "States" is a list of states, the key is the sort order of the state in the widget. "Default" determines if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTLLocal" is the cache time in minutes for the plugin. "Mandatory" determines if the plugin is always shown and can not be removed by agents.

Hash.Item: Provides a matrix overview of the tickets per state per queue

Setting.Name: DashboardEventsTicketCalendar###CalendarWidth
Setting.Description: Defines the calendar width in percent. Default is 95%.

Setting.Name: DashboardEventsTicketCalendar###Queues
Setting.Description: Defines queues that's tickets are used for displaying as calendar events.

Setting.Name: DashboardEventsTicketCalendar::DynamicFieldStartTime
Setting.Description: Define dynamic field name for start time. This field has to be manually added to the system as Ticket: "Date / Time" and must be activated in ticket creation screens and/or in any other ticket action screens.

Setting.Name: DashboardEventsTicketCalendar::DynamicFieldEndTime
Setting.Description: Define dynamic field name for end time. This field has to be manually added to the system as Ticket: "Date / Time" and must be activated in ticket creation screens and/or in any other ticket action screens.

Setting.Name: DashboardEventsTicketCalendar::DynamicFieldsForEvents
Setting.Description: Defines the dynamic fields that are used for displaying on calendar events.

Setting.Name: DashboardEventsTicketCalendar::TicketFieldsForEvents
Setting.Description: Defines the ticket fields that are going to be displayed calendar events. The "Key" defines the field or ticket attribute and the "Content" defines the display name.

Setting.Name: OnlyValuesOnTicket
Setting.Description: Defines if the values for filters should be retrieved from all available tickets. If enabled, only values which are actually used in any ticket will be available for filtering. Please note: The list of customers will always be retrieved like this.

Setting.Name: AgentCustomerUserInformationCenter::Backend###0050-CUIC-CustomerIDList
Setting.Description: Parameters for the dashboard backend of the customer id list overview of the agent interface . "Limit" is the number of entries shown by default. "Group" is used to restrict the access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" determines if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTLLocal" is the cache time in minutes for the plugin.

Hash.Item: All CustomerIDs of a customer user.

Setting.Name: AgentCustomerUserInformationCenter::Backend###0100-CUIC-TicketPendingReminder
Setting.Description: Parameters for the dashboard backend of the ticket pending reminder overview of the agent interface. "Limit" is the number of entries shown by default. "Group" is used to restrict the access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" determines if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTLLocal" is the cache time in minutes for the plugin. Note: Only Ticket attributes and Dynamic Fields (DynamicField_NameX) are allowed for DefaultColumns.

Hash.Item: All tickets with a reminder set where the reminder date has been reached

Setting.Name: AgentCustomerUserInformationCenter::Backend###0110-CUIC-TicketEscalation
Setting.Description: Parameters for the dashboard backend of the ticket escalation overview of the agent interface. "Limit" is the number of entries shown by default. "Group" is used to restrict the access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" determines if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTLLocal" is the cache time in minutes for the plugin. Note: Only Ticket attributes and Dynamic Fields (DynamicField_NameX) are allowed for DefaultColumns.

Setting.Name: AgentCustomerUserInformationCenter::Backend###0120-CUIC-TicketNew
Setting.Description: Parameters for the dashboard backend of the new tickets overview of the agent interface. "Limit" is the number of entries shown by default. "Group" is used to restrict the access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" determines if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTLLocal" is the cache time in minutes for the plugin. Note: Only Ticket attributes and Dynamic Fields (DynamicField_NameX) are allowed for DefaultColumns.

Hash.Item: All new tickets, these tickets have not been worked on yet

Setting.Name: AgentCustomerUserInformationCenter::Backend###0130-CUIC-TicketOpen
Setting.Description: Parameters for the dashboard backend of the open tickets overview of the agent interface. "Limit" is the number of entries shown by default. "Group" is used to restrict the access to the plugin (e. g. Group: admin;group1;group2;). "Default" determines if the plugin is enabled by default or if the user needs to enable it manually. "CacheTTLLocal" is the cache time in minutes for the plugin. Note: Only Ticket attributes and Dynamic Fields (DynamicField_NameX) are allowed for DefaultColumns.

Hash.Item: All open tickets, these tickets have already been worked on.

Setting.Name: PreferencesGroups###CustomQueue
Setting.Description: Parameters for the CustomQueue object in the preference view of the agent interface. Please note: setting 'Active' to 0 will only prevent agents from editing settings of this group in their personal preferences, but will still allow administrators to edit the settings of another user's behalf. Use 'PreferenceGroup' to control in which area these settings should be shown in the user interface.

Hash.Item: Your queue selection of your preferred queues. You also get notified about those queues via email if enabled.

Setting.Name: PreferencesGroups###CustomService
Setting.Description: Parameters for the CustomService object in the preference view of the agent interface. Please note: setting 'Active' to 0 will only prevent agents from editing settings of this group in their personal preferences, but will still allow administrators to edit the settings of another user's behalf. Use 'PreferenceGroup' to control in which area these settings should be shown in the user interface.

Hash.Item: Your service selection of your preferred services. You also get notified about those services via email if enabled.

Setting.Name: PreferencesGroups###RefreshTime
Setting.Description: Parameters for the RefreshTime object in the preference view of the agent interface. Please note: setting 'Active' to 0 will only prevent agents from editing settings of this group in their personal preferences, but will still allow administrators to edit the settings of another user's behalf. Use 'PreferenceGroup' to control in which area these settings should be shown in the user interface.

Hash.Item: If enabled, the different overviews (Dashboard, LockedView, QueueView) will automatically refresh after the specified time.

Setting.Name: PreferencesGroups###TicketOverviewSmallPageShown
Setting.Description: Parameters for the pages (in which the tickets are shown) of the small ticket overview. Please note: setting 'Active' to 0 will only prevent agents from editing settings of this group in their personal preferences, but will still allow administrators to edit the settings of another user's behalf. Use 'PreferenceGroup' to control in which area these settings should be shown in the user interface.

Hash.Item: Ticket limit per page for Ticket Overview "Small".

Setting.Name: PreferencesGroups###TicketOverviewFilterSettings
Setting.Description: Parameters for the column filters of the small ticket overview. Please note: setting 'Active' to 0 will only prevent agents from editing settings of this group in their personal preferences, but will still allow administrators to edit the settings of another user's behalf. Use 'PreferenceGroup' to control in which area these settings should be shown in the user interface.

Hash.Item: Column ticket filters for Ticket Overviews type "Small".

Setting.Name: PreferencesGroups###TicketOverviewMediumPageShown
Setting.Description: Parameters for the pages (in which the tickets are shown) of the medium ticket overview. Please note: setting 'Active' to 0 will only prevent agents from editing settings of this group in their personal preferences, but will still allow administrators to edit the settings of another user's behalf. Use 'PreferenceGroup' to control in which area these settings should be shown in the user interface.

Hash.Item: Ticket limit per page for Ticket Overview "Medium".

Setting.Name: PreferencesGroups###TicketOverviewPreviewPageShown
Setting.Description: Parameters for the pages (in which the tickets are shown) of the ticket preview overview. Please note: setting 'Active' to 0 will only prevent agents from editing settings of this group in their personal preferences, but will still allow administrators to edit the settings of another user's behalf. Use 'PreferenceGroup' to control in which area these settings should be shown in the user interface.

Hash.Item: Ticket limit per page for Ticket Overview "Preview".

Setting.Name: PreferencesGroups###CreateNextMask
Setting.Description: Parameters for the CreateNextMask object in the preference view of the agent interface. Please note: setting 'Active' to 0 will only prevent agents from editing settings of this group in their personal preferences, but will still allow administrators to edit the settings of another user's behalf. Use 'PreferenceGroup' to control in which area these settings should be shown in the user interface.

Hash.Item: Configure which screen should be shown after a new ticket has been created.

Setting.Name: SLAPreferences###Comment2
Setting.Description: Parameters of the example SLA attribute Comment2.

Setting.Name: CustomerNotifyJustToRealCustomer
Setting.Description: Sends customer notifications just to the mapped customer.

Setting.Name: AgentSelfNotifyOnAction
Setting.Description: Specifies if an agent should receive email notification of his own actions.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketMessage###NextScreenAfterNewTicket
Setting.Description: Determines the next screen after new customer ticket in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketMessage###Priority
Setting.Description: Allows customers to set the ticket priority in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketMessage###PriorityDefault
Setting.Description: Defines the default priority of new customer tickets in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketMessage###Queue
Setting.Description: Allows customers to set the ticket queue in the customer interface. If this is not enabled, QueueDefault should be configured.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketMessage###QueueDefault
Setting.Description: Defines the default queue for new customer tickets in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketMessage###TicketType
Setting.Description: Allows customers to set the ticket type in the customer interface. If this is not enabled, TicketTypeDefault should be configured.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketMessage###TicketTypeDefault
Setting.Description: Defines the default ticket type for new customer tickets in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketMessage###Service
Setting.Description: Allows customers to set the ticket service in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketMessage###SLA
Setting.Description: Allows customers to set the ticket SLA in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketMessage###ServiceMandatory
Setting.Description: Sets if service must be selected by the customer.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketMessage###SLAMandatory
Setting.Description: Sets if SLA must be selected by the customer.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketMessage###StateDefault
Setting.Description: Defines the default state of new customer tickets in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketMessage###SenderType
Setting.Description: Sender type for new tickets from the customer inteface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketMessage###HistoryType
Setting.Description: Defines the default history type in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketMessage###HistoryComment
Setting.Description: Comment for new history entries in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: CustomerPanelSelectionType
Setting.Description: Defines the recipient target of the tickets ("Queue" shows all queues, "SystemAddress" shows only the queues which are assigned to system addresses) in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: CustomerPanelSelectionString
Setting.Description: Determines the strings that will be shown as recipient (To:) of the ticket in the customer interface. For Queue as CustomerPanelSelectionType, "<Queue>" shows the names of the queues, and for SystemAddress, "<Realname> <<Email>>" shows the name and email of the recipient.

Setting.Name: CustomerPanelOwnSelection
Setting.Description: Determines which queues will be valid for ticket's recepients in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: CustomerPanel::NewTicketQueueSelectionModule
Setting.Description: Module for To-selection in new ticket screen in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketZoom###NextScreenAfterFollowUp
Setting.Description: Determines the next screen after the follow-up screen of a zoomed ticket in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketZoom###SenderType
Setting.Description: Defines the default sender type for tickets in the ticket zoom screen of the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketZoom###HistoryType
Setting.Description: Defines the history type for the ticket zoom action, which gets used for ticket history in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketZoom###HistoryComment
Setting.Description: Defines the history comment for the ticket zoom action, which gets used for ticket history in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketZoom###Priority
Setting.Description: Allows customers to change the ticket priority in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketZoom###PriorityDefault
Setting.Description: Defines the default priority of follow-up customer tickets in the ticket zoom screen in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketZoom###State
Setting.Description: Allows choosing the next compose state for customer tickets in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketZoom###StateDefault
Setting.Description: Defines the default next state for a ticket after customer follow-up in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketZoom###StateType
Setting.Description: Defines the next possible states for customer tickets in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketZoom###AttributesView
Setting.Description: Shows the enabled ticket attributes in the customer interface (0 = Disabled and 1 = Enabled).

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketZoom###ZoomTimeDisplay
Setting.Description: Displays the accounted time for an article in the ticket zoom view.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketZoom###CustomerZoomExpand
Setting.Description: Shows all the articles of the ticket (expanded) in the customer zoom view.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketZoom###DisplayNoteFrom
Setting.Description: Defines the displayed style of the From field in notes that are visible for customers. A default agent name can be defined in Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketZoom###DefaultAgentName setting.

Item.Item: The value of the From field

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketZoom###DefaultAgentName
Setting.Description: Defines the default agent name in the ticket zoom view of the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::CustomerTicketSearch::SearchLimit
Setting.Description: Maximum number of tickets to be displayed in the result of a search in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::CustomerTicketSearch::SearchPageShown
Setting.Description: Number of tickets to be displayed in each page of a search result in the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::CustomerTicketSearch::SortBy::Default
Setting.Description: Defines the default ticket attribute for ticket sorting in a ticket search of the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::CustomerTicketSearch::Order::Default
Setting.Description: Defines the default ticket order of a search result in the customer interface. Up: oldest on top. Down: latest on top.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketSearch###ExtendedSearchCondition
Setting.Description: Allows extended search conditions in ticket search of the customer interface. With this feature you can search e. g. ticket title with this kind of conditions like "(*key1*&&*key2*)" or "(*key1*||*key2*)".

Setting.Name: Customer::TicketSearch::AllServices
Setting.Description: If enabled, the customer can search for tickets in all services (regardless what services are assigned to the customer).

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketSearch###SearchArticleCSVTree
Setting.Description: Exports the whole article tree in search result (it can affect the system performance).

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketSearch###SearchCSVData
Setting.Description: Data used to export the search result in CSV format.

Setting.Name: CustomerPreferencesGroups###ShownTickets
Setting.Description: Defines all the parameters for the ShownTickets object in the customer preferences of the customer interface.

Hash.Item: Select how many tickets should be shown in overviews by default.

Setting.Name: CustomerPreferencesGroups###RefreshTime
Setting.Description: Defines all the parameters for the RefreshTime object in the customer preferences of the customer interface.

Hash.Item: Select after which period ticket overviews should refresh automatically.

Setting.Description: Default ACL values for ticket actions.

Setting.Description: Defines which items are available in first level of the ACL structure.

Setting.Name: ACLKeysLevel1Change
Setting.Description: Defines which items are available in first level of the ACL structure.

Setting.Description: Defines which items are available in second level of the ACL structure.

Setting.Description: Defines which items are available in second level of the ACL structure.

Setting.Name: TicketACL::Debug::LogPriority
Setting.Description: Defines the priority in which the information is logged and presented.

Setting.Name: TicketACL::Debug::Filter###00-Default
Setting.Description: Filter for debugging ACLs. Note: More ticket attributes can be added in the format <OTRS_TICKET_Attribute> e.g. <OTRS_TICKET_Priority>.

Setting.Name: PostmasterMaxEmails
Setting.Description: Maximal auto email responses to own email-address a day (Loop-Protection).

Setting.Name: PostmasterMaxEmailsPerAddress
Setting.Description: Maximal auto email responses to own email-address a day, configurable by email address (Loop-Protection).

Setting.Name: PostMasterMaxEmailSize
Setting.Description: Maximal size in KBytes for mails that can be fetched via POP3/POP3S/IMAP/IMAPS (KBytes).

Setting.Name: PostMasterReconnectMessage
Setting.Description: The maximum number of mails fetched at once before reconnecting to the server.

Setting.Name: LoopProtectionModule
Setting.Description: Default loop protection module.

Setting.Name: LoopProtectionLog
Setting.Description: Path for the log file (it only applies if "FS" was selected for LoopProtectionModule and it is mandatory).

Setting.Name: PostmasterAutoHTML2Text
Setting.Description: Converts HTML mails into text messages.

Setting.Name: PostmasterUserID
Setting.Description: Specifies user id of the postmaster data base.

Setting.Name: PostmasterDefaultQueue
Setting.Description: Defines the postmaster default queue.

Setting.Name: PostmasterDefaultPriority
Setting.Description: Defines the default priority of new tickets.

Setting.Name: PostmasterDefaultState
Setting.Description: Defines the default state of new tickets.

Setting.Name: PostmasterFollowUpState
Setting.Description: Defines the state of a ticket if it gets a follow-up.

Setting.Name: PostmasterFollowUpStateClosed
Setting.Description: Defines the state of a ticket if it gets a follow-up and the ticket was already closed.

Setting.Name: KeepStateHeader
Setting.Description: Defines the PostMaster header to be used on the filter for keeping the current state of the ticket.

Setting.Name: PostmasterFollowUpOnUnlockAgentNotifyOnlyToOwner
Setting.Description: Sends agent follow-up notification only to the owner, if a ticket is unlocked (the default is to send the notification to all agents).

Setting.Name: PostmasterHeaderFieldCount
Setting.Description: Defines the number of header fields in frontend modules for add and update postmaster filters. It can be up to 99 fields.

Setting.Name: PostmasterBounceEmailAsFollowUp
Setting.Description: Indicates if a bounce e-mail should always be treated as normal follow-up.

Setting.Name: PostmasterX-Header
Setting.Description: Defines all the X-headers that should be scanned.

Setting.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###1-Match
Setting.Description: Module to filter and manipulate incoming messages. Block/ignore all spam email with From: noreply@ address.

Setting.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###2-Match
Setting.Description: Module to filter and manipulate incoming messages. Get a 4 digit number to ticket free text, use regex in Match e. g. From => '(.+?)@.+?', and use () as [***] in Set =>.

Setting.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###3-NewTicketReject
Setting.Description: Blocks all the incoming emails that do not have a valid ticket number in subject with From: @example.com address.

Setting.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule::NewTicketReject::Sender
Setting.Description: Defines the sender for rejected emails.

Setting.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule::NewTicketReject::Subject
Setting.Description: Defines the subject for rejected emails.

Setting.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule::NewTicketReject::Body
Setting.Description: Defines the body text for rejected emails.

Value.Item:
Dear Customer,
Unfortunately we could not detect a valid ticket number in your subject, so this email can't be processed.
Please create a new ticket via the customer panel.
Thanks for your help!
Your Helpdesk Team

Setting.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###4-CMD
Setting.Description: CMD example setup. Ignores emails where external CMD returns some output on STDOUT (email will be piped into STDIN of some.bin).

Setting.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###5-SpamAssassin
Setting.Description: Spam Assassin example setup. Ignores emails that are marked with SpamAssassin.

Setting.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###6-SpamAssassin
Setting.Description: Spam Assassin example setup. Moves marked mails to spam queue.

Setting.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###000-MatchDBSource
Setting.Description: Module to use database filter storage.

Setting.Name: PostMaster::PreCreateFilterModule###000-FollowUpArticleVisibilityCheck
Setting.Description: Module to check if arrived emails should be marked as internal (because of original forwarded internal email). IsVisibleForCustomer and SenderType define the values for the arrived email/article.

Setting.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###000-ExternalTicketNumberRecognition1
Setting.Description: Recognize if a ticket is a follow-up to an existing ticket using an external ticket number. Note: the first capturing group from the 'NumberRegExp' expression will be used as the ticket number value.

Setting.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###000-ExternalTicketNumberRecognition2
Setting.Description: Recognize if a ticket is a follow-up to an existing ticket using an external ticket number. Note: the first capturing group from the 'NumberRegExp' expression will be used as the ticket number value.

Setting.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###000-ExternalTicketNumberRecognition3
Setting.Description: Recognize if a ticket is a follow-up to an existing ticket using an external ticket number. Note: the first capturing group from the 'NumberRegExp' expression will be used as the ticket number value.

Setting.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###000-ExternalTicketNumberRecognition4
Setting.Description: Recognize if a ticket is a follow-up to an existing ticket using an external ticket number. Note: the first capturing group from the 'NumberRegExp' expression will be used as the ticket number value.

Setting.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###000-DecryptBody
Setting.Description: Module to filter encrypted bodies of incoming messages.

Setting.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###000-SMIMEFetchFromCustomer
Setting.Description: Module to fetch customer users SMIME certificates of incoming messages.

Setting.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###000-DetectBounceEmail
Setting.Description: Module to check if a incoming e-mail message is bounce.

Setting.Name: PostMaster::PreFilterModule###000-DetectAttachment
Setting.Description: Module used to detect if attachments are present.

Setting.Name: PostMaster::CheckFollowUpModule###0000-BounceEmail
Setting.Description: Executes follow-up checks on OTRS Header 'X-OTRS-Bounce'.

Setting.Name: PostMaster::CheckFollowUpModule###0100-Subject
Setting.Description: Checks if an E-Mail is a followup to an existing ticket by searching the subject for a valid ticket number.

Setting.Name: PostMaster::CheckFollowUpModule###0200-References
Setting.Description: Executes follow-up checks on In-Reply-To or References headers for mails that don't have a ticket number in the subject.

Setting.Name: PostMaster::CheckFollowUpModule###0300-Body
Setting.Description: Executes follow-up checks on email body for mails that don't have a ticket number in the subject.

Setting.Name: PostMaster::CheckFollowUpModule###0400-Attachments
Setting.Description: Executes follow-up checks on attachment contents for mails that don't have a ticket number in the subject.

Setting.Name: PostMaster::CheckFollowUpModule###0500-RawEmail
Setting.Description: Executes follow-up checks on the raw source email for mails that don't have a ticket number in the subject.

Setting.Name: PostMaster::CheckFollowUpModule###0600-ExternalTicketNumberRecognition
Setting.Description: Checks if an email is a follow-up to an existing ticket with external ticket number which can be found by ExternalTicketNumberRecognition filter module.

Setting.Name: PostMaster::NewTicket::AutoAssignCustomerIDForUnknownCustomers
Setting.Description: Controls if CustomerID is automatically copied from the sender address for unknown customers.

Setting.Name: SendNoAutoResponseRegExp
Setting.Description: If this regex matches, no message will be send by the autoresponder.

Setting.Name: AutoResponseForWebTickets
Setting.Description: If this option is enabled, tickets created via the web interface, via Customers or Agents, will receive an autoresponse if configured. If this option is not enabled, no autoresponses will be sent.

Setting.Name: LinkObject::PossibleLink###0200
Setting.Description: Links 2 tickets with a "Normal" type link.

Setting.Name: LinkObject::PossibleLink###0201
Setting.Description: Links 2 tickets with a "ParentChild" type link.

Setting.Name: LinkObject::IgnoreLinkedTicketStateTypes
Setting.Description: Defines, which tickets of which ticket state types should not be listed in linked ticket lists.

Setting.Name: LinkObject::StrikeThroughLinkedTicketStateTypes
Setting.Description: For these state types the ticket numbers are striked through in the link table.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketSearch###SearchOverviewDynamicField
Setting.Description: Dynamic fields shown in the ticket search overview results screen of the customer interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::CustomerTicketSearch###SearchCSVDynamicField
Setting.Description: Dynamic Fields used to export the search result in CSV format.

Setting.Name: Ticket::EventModulePost###9600-TicketDynamicFieldDefault
Setting.Description: Event module registration. For more performance you can define a trigger event (e. g. Event => TicketCreate). This is only possible if all Ticket dynamic fields need the same event.

Setting.Name: Ticket::TicketDynamicFieldDefault###Element1
Setting.Description: Configures a default TicketDynamicField setting. "Name" defines the dynamic field which should be used, "Value" is the data that will be set, and "Event" defines the trigger event. Please check the developer manual (https://doc.otrs.com/doc/), chapter "Ticket Event Module".

Setting.Name: StandardTemplate::Types
Setting.Description: Defines the list of types for templates.

Setting.Name: StandardTemplate2QueueByCreating
Setting.Description: List of default Standard Templates which are assigned automatically to new Queues upon creation.

Setting.Name: DefaultOverviewColumns
Setting.Description: General ticket data shown in the ticket overviews (fall-back). Note that TicketNumber can not be disabled, because it is necessary.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketStatusView###DefaultColumns
Setting.Description: Columns that can be filtered in the status view of the agent interface. Note: Only Ticket attributes, Dynamic Fields (DynamicField_NameX) and Customer attributes (e.g. CustomerUserPhone, CustomerCompanyName, ...) are allowed.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketQueue###DefaultColumns
Setting.Description: Columns that can be filtered in the queue view of the agent interface. Note: Only Ticket attributes, Dynamic Fields (DynamicField_NameX) and Customer attributes (e.g. CustomerUserPhone, CustomerCompanyName, ...) are allowed.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketResponsibleView###DefaultColumns
Setting.Description: Columns that can be filtered in the responsible view of the agent interface. Note: Only Ticket attributes, Dynamic Fields (DynamicField_NameX) and Customer attributes (e.g. CustomerUserPhone, CustomerCompanyName, ...) are allowed.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketWatchView###DefaultColumns
Setting.Description: Columns that can be filtered in the watch view of the agent interface. Note: Only Ticket attributes, Dynamic Fields (DynamicField_NameX) and Customer attributes (e.g. CustomerUserPhone, CustomerCompanyName, ...) are allowed.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketLockedView###DefaultColumns
Setting.Description: Columns that can be filtered in the locked view of the agent interface. Note: Only Ticket attributes, Dynamic Fields (DynamicField_NameX) and Customer attributes (e.g. CustomerUserPhone, CustomerCompanyName, ...) are allowed.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketEscalationView###DefaultColumns
Setting.Description: Columns that can be filtered in the escalation view of the agent interface. Note: Only Ticket attributes, Dynamic Fields (DynamicField_NameX) and Customer attributes (e.g. CustomerUserPhone, CustomerCompanyName, ...) are allowed.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketSearch###DefaultColumns
Setting.Description: Columns that can be filtered in the ticket search result view of the agent interface. Note: Only Ticket attributes, Dynamic Fields (DynamicField_NameX) and Customer attributes (e.g. CustomerUserPhone, CustomerCompanyName, ...) are allowed.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketService###DefaultColumns
Setting.Description: Columns that can be filtered in the service view of the agent interface. Note: Only Ticket attributes, Dynamic Fields (DynamicField_NameX) and Customer attributes (e.g. CustomerUserPhone, CustomerCompanyName, ...) are allowed.

Setting.Name: Frontend::NavBarModule###7-AgentTicketService
Setting.Description: Frontend module registration (disable AgentTicketService link if Ticket Service feature is not used).

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::DefaultRecipientDisplayType
Setting.Description: Default display type for recipient (To,Cc) names in AgentTicketZoom and CustomerTicketZoom.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::DefaultSenderDisplayType
Setting.Description: Default display type for sender (From) names in AgentTicketZoom and CustomerTicketZoom.

Setting.Name: LinkObject::ComplexTable::SettingsVisibility###Ticket
Setting.Description: Define Actions where a settings button is available in the linked objects widget (LinkObject::ViewMode = "complex"). Please note that these Actions must have registered the following JS and CSS files: Core.AllocationList.css, Core.UI.AllocationList.js, Core.UI.Table.Sort.js, Core.Agent.TableFilters.js.

Setting.Name: LinkObject::ComplexTable###Ticket
Setting.Description: Define which columns are shown in the linked tickets widget (LinkObject::ViewMode = "complex"). Note: Only Ticket attributes and Dynamic Fields (DynamicField_NameX) are allowed for DefaultColumns.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ZoomCollectMeta
Setting.Description: Whether or not to collect meta information from articles using filters configured in Ticket::Frontend::ZoomCollectMetaFilters.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ZoomCollectMetaFilters###CVE-Mitre
Setting.Description: Defines a filter to collect CVE numbers from article texts in AgentTicketZoom. The results will be displayed in a meta box next to the article. Fill in URLPreview if you would like to see a preview when moving your mouse cursor above the link element. This could be the same URL as in URL, but also an alternate one. Please note that some websites deny being displayed within an iframe (e.g. Google) and thus won't work with the preview mode.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::ZoomCollectMetaFilters###CVE-Google
Setting.Description: Defines a filter to collect CVE numbers from article texts in AgentTicketZoom. The results will be displayed in a meta box next to the article. Fill in URLPreview if you would like to see a preview when moving your mouse cursor above the link element. This could be the same URL as in URL, but also an alternate one. Please note that some websites deny being displayed within an iframe (e.g. Google) and thus won't work with the preview mode.

Setting.Name: Frontend::Module###AgentSplitSelection
Setting.Description: Frontend module registration for the agent interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketEmail###SplitLinkType
Setting.Description: Sets the default link type of split tickets in the agent interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::AgentTicketProcess###SplitLinkType
Setting.Description: Sets the default link type of split tickets in the agent interface.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::Article::Actions###Internal
Setting.Description: Defines available article actions for Internal articles.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::Article::Actions###Phone
Setting.Description: Defines available article actions for Phone articles.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::Article::Actions###Email
Setting.Description: Defines available article actions for Email articles.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::Article::Actions###Chat
Setting.Description: Defines available article actions for Chat articles.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::Article::Actions###Invalid
Setting.Description: Defines available article actions for invalid articles.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::RedirectAfterCloseDisabled
Setting.Description: Disables the redirection to the last screen overview / dashboard after a ticket is closed.

Setting.Name: Ticket::Frontend::UserDefaultQueue
Setting.Description: Defines the default queue for new tickets in the agent interface.
